author: Paul Hannon
title: Ireland Votes Whether to Repeal Abortion Ban as Catholic Influence Wanes
text:
Irish voters are deciding Friday whether to remove a ban on abortion from the countryâ€™s constitution, a sweeping change that would further dilute church influence in a country steadily moving away from its Catholic roots.
Polls show a majority in favor of lifting the ban, with younger, urban Irish people more strongly in favor than older, rural voters. But many remain undecided and the referendum has been hotly debated, with dueling rallies and signs both for and against plastered around the country.
